profileText: (Father of Lemuel Hastings Arnold and great-great-grandfather of Theodore Francis Green), a Delegate from Rhode Island; born in Providence, R.I., December 3, 1741; studied medicine and practiced; member of the general assembly of Rhode Island from Providence in 1776; served in the Revolutionary Army as surgeon; director of the Army hospital in Providence; Member of the Continental Congress 1782-1783; moved to St. Johnsbury, Vt., in 1787 and engaged in agricultural pursuits; appointed a member of the Governor's council; was appointed judge of Orange County and served until his death in St. Johnsbury, Caledonia County, Vt., February 1, 1793; interment in Mount Pleasant Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: 1782, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Jonathan Arnold to an unidentified correspondent written on December 7, 1782. In the letter, Jonathan Arnold criticizes Congress for financial waste and neglect, increasing bureaucracy, mismanagement of the army, and demanding powers beyond those granted by the Articles of Confederation.

researchRecord.name: In the Jonathan Arnold papers, 1790-1819 and undated, 6 folders.
researchRecord.description: The collection includes a transcription of a 1792 love letter from Jonathan Arnold to his wife Cynthia (1819); a letter to Daniel Cahoon (1790); two deeds transferring land from Jonathan Arnold to Barnabas Barker, a deed transferring land from John Barker, Jr., to John Barker, Sr. (all probably in Vermont), and biographical materials collected and authored by Edward T. Fairbanks.
